### Request for Proposal for RCMP Pistol Modernization

#### Tender Information

* Reference Number: PW-__BM-039-29244
* Solicitation Number: M7594-224467/F
* Publication Date: December 15, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: June 7, 2024 at 2:00 PM Eastern Time
* Amendment Number: 9
* Amendment Date: June 5, 2024

#### RFP Description

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking a contractor to provide modernized pistols and ancillary equipment, training, and support for the pistol and accessories. The contract will encompass the provision of pistols, training pistols, and associated accessories, inclusive of a red dot sight and LED weapon light.

The delivery dates for the contract are to be determined, and the Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. The documents may be submitted in either of Canada's official languages.

#### Requirements

* Deliver pistols and ancillary equipment to the RCMP
* Provide training and support for the pistol and accessories
* Ensure pistols are zeroed and configured for use with the red dot sight and LED weapon light
* Provide a subsequent standing offer for pistol spare parts if required

#### Evaluation Criteria

The selection criteria for this RFP will be based on a combined rating of technical merit and price. The contractor will be evaluated on their ability to meet the project requirements and provide a suitable solution.

#### Contact Information

For more information or to obtain a copy of the RFP, please contact:

Keith Grosser
Public Works and Government Services Canada
Phone: (873) 355-2334
Email: [Keith.Grosser@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:Keith.Grosser@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

#### Attachments

A copy of the RFP, including all attachments, can be accessed through the Government of Canada's e-buying system. The attachments include the RFP document, pricing information, and any relevant technical specifications.

#### Important Note

The tender has expired, and no further submissions will be accepted.  Please note that it is the responsibility of the supplier to ensure they meet all eligibility criteria prior to submitting a bid. The Government of Canada is not responsible for any errors or omissions in the tender information.
